description: Comprehensive monitoring dashboard for Virtual Machines using OpenTelemetry host metrics with NVIDIA GPU support

targets.expr: (sum by(exported_job, device, mountpoint) (system_filesystem_usage{exported_job=~"$vm",state="used",type!~"tmpfs|squashfs"}) / sum by(exported_job, device, mountpoint) (system_filesystem_usage{exported_job=~"$vm",state=~"used|free",type!~"tmpfs|squashfs"})) * 100

(sum by(exported_job, device, mountpoint) (system_filesystem_inodes_usage{exported_job=~"$vm",state="used",type!~"tmpfs|squashfs"}) / sum by(exported_job, device, mountpoint) (system_filesystem_inodes_usage{exported_job=~"$vm",state=~"used|free",type!~"tmpfs|squashfs"})) * 100

panels.description: The official product name of the GPU. This is an alphanumeric string. For all products.
panels.title: Name

panels.description: The current performance state for the GPU. States range from P0 (maximum performance) to P12 (minimum performance).
panels.title: P-State

panels.description:
Percent of time over the past sample period during which one or more kernels was executing on the GPU.
The sample period may be between 1 second and 1/6 second depending on the product.
panels.title: GPU Utilization %

panels.description: The last measured power draw for the entire board, in watts. Only available if power management is supported. This reading is accurate to within +/- 5 watts / The software power limit in watts.
panels.title: Power Draw %

panels.description: The fan speed value is the percent of the product's maximum noise tolerance fan speed that the device's fan is currently intended to run at. This value may exceed 100% in certain cases. Note: The reported speed is the intended fan speed. If the fan is physically blocked and unable to spin, this output will not match the actual fan speed. Many parts do not report fan speeds because they rely on cooling via fans in the surrounding enclosure.
panels.title: Fan Speed %

panels.description: Core GPU temperature. in degrees C.
panels.title: Temperature

panels.description:
Percent of time over the past sample period during which global (device) memory was being read or written.
The sample period may be between 1 second and 1/6 second depending on the product.
panels.title: Memory Utilization %

panels.description: The version of the installed NVIDIA display driver. This is an alphanumeric string.
panels.title: Driver Version

panels.description: The BIOS of the GPU board.
panels.title: Vbios Version

panels.description: Information about factors that are reducing the frequency of clocks. If all throttle reasons are returned as "Not Active" it means that clocks are running as high as possible.
panels.title: Throttle Reasons

panels.description:
Current frequency of graphics (shader) clock
/
Maximum frequency of graphics (shader) clock.
panels.title: GPU Clock Speed %

panels.description: Current frequency of memory clock / Maximum frequency of memory clock
panels.title: Memory Clock Speed %

panels.description: Total memory allocated by active contexts / Total installed GPU memory.
panels.title: Memory Allocation %

panels.description:
Percent of time over the past sample period during which global (device) memory was being read or written.
The sample period may be between 1 second and 1/6 second depending on the product.
panels.title: Memory Utilization %

panels.description:
Percent of time over the past sample period during which one or more kernels was executing on the GPU.
The sample period may be between 1 second and 1/6 second depending on the product.
panels.title: GPU Utilization %

panels.description: Total memory allocated by active contexts.
panels.title: Memory Allocation

panels.description: Core GPU temperature. in degrees C.
panels.title: Temperature

panels.description: The last measured power draw for the entire board, in watts. Only available if power management is supported. This reading is accurate to within +/- 5 watts
panels.title: Power Draw

panels.description: The fan speed value is the percent of the product's maximum noise tolerance fan speed that the device's fan is currently intended to run at. This value may exceed 100% in certain cases. Note: The reported speed is the intended fan speed. If the fan is physically blocked and unable to spin, this output will not match the actual fan speed. Many parts do not report fan speeds because they rely on cooling via fans in the surrounding enclosure.
panels.title: Fan Speed %

panels.description: Current frequency of graphics (shader) clock.
panels.title: Graphics Clock Speed

panels.description: Current frequency of video encoder/decoder clock.
panels.title: Video Clock Speed

panels.description: Current frequency of SM (Streaming Multiprocessor) clock.
panels.title: SM Clock Speed

panels.description: Current frequency of memory clock.
panels.title: Memory Clock Speed

title: Virtual Machines
